turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Ugh, this smart thermostat is driving me crazy! It keeps setting the temperature to 85 degrees, even when I tell it to be 70. What's going on?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I understand you're having trouble with your smart thermostat. To help me troubleshoot, could you please provide the model number of your device?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: It's the ThermoSmart 3000. I've tried resetting it multiple times, but it just keeps reverting back to that ridiculous temperature. Am I missing something obvious here?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. Please try unplugging the device, waiting 30 seconds, and then plugging it back in. This will perform a hard reset. Let me know if that helps!

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Okay, I just did that. It *seems* to be holding the temperature now. But what if this keeps happening? Is there some sort of software conflict or something that's causing it to do this? I don't want to have to keep resetting this thing every day.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: That's a good question. While we haven't identified a specific software conflict for the ThermoSmart 3000, intermittent issues can sometimes arise from fluctuations in your home's Wi-Fi signal strength. I would recommend ensuring your router's firmware is up to date, and that the thermostat is within a reasonable proximity to the router to minimize signal interference. If the problem persists, please contact us again with details about your router model and firmware version.
